It wasn't that good to my taste...it wasn't disgusting either. it was in the middle. But i tried my friends food and his was uber delish. i believe he ordered the  sul ung tang. I will have to go back very soon to try some other stuff on the menu.
author: Suzan L.

description: 4 Stars (only for Stews) - I tried the soon doo bu jiggae - oh many seafood soft tofu stew, how I love you. Coming to this place was definitely like going to my mom's house if she was korean (which I think is what the name of the place translates to). Food is so homey, service is warm, and she made sure we were okay. Can't recommend everything on the menu since I've only tried the soondoobu, but can definitely recommend this. Will be back on a cold night.
author: Jeannette L.

description:
Three star ratings on yelp are deceiving...three stars doesn't mean its bad, just slightly above average. 

I live downtown, which seems to be lacking in Korean food, so we made the trip out further to find some. The place was empty when we came around 7, and only a few other people came after us for dinner. I hate when Korean restaurants skimp on their little appetizer dishes, but the ones that came out were all pretty decent. We ordered the BBQ pork (bul go gi) which you can never go wrong with. However, the spicy rice cake dish (duk bok ki?) wasn't quite what I expected. I like when it comes as like long cylinders of rice cake, but this place had flat pancake pieces. I guess this is just a personal preference, but I've definitely had the dish with better flavors at other places.
author: Jeffrey T.

description: Uh.. I guess this place is alright? The only thing that I like about this place is the late night hours... and that is about it with this place. The service is pretty slow, the food is not that great, the waitress barely knew how to speak english =\... Yeah.. this is one place that I would only come back if tofu house is closed...
author: Johnny T.

description: I had a seafood pancake and bibimbap here. Both were delicious. The old lady that runs the place was cute. She came out and said hello at the beginning and end of our meal. The guy working in the front was also very nice.
author: Steve C.

description: Korean food in Los Angeles is really spectacular, this is true. But after eating here, I don't know if I can say that the Korean in LA is better. It was delish. So good. Sooooo good.
author: Rikki D.

description: I love little mom and pop restaurants and always try to support them. Go ki soon du bu is the perfect end to a long work day. It's soothing and comforting and delicious. This place is perfect after carousing at Trader's Sam and need some late night nourishment.
author: Sophia C.

description: The kimchee fried rice is pretty greasy here and lacks the beef that is mentioned on the menu.  But, the kimchee pancake is pretty good.  The short rib soup with silver noodles skimps on the noodles.  I suppose this joint is good for its spicy tofu soup and the bi bim bop.
author: Linda P.

description:
Forget Brothers---for all you late night seekers of REAL home spun Korean food in the tidiest, cleanest kitchen you will find in SF---UMMA SON ROCKS!!  The soups are top notch made with time honored tradition of boiling only the best cut of meat and fish to make broth that would rival any 5 star restaurant.   Try the KALBI JIM (slow cooked fall of the bone ribs)  KALBI TANG (amazing broth with Kalbi) Grilled Mackeral---deboned and unrivaled in the city.

Cooking is an art form here and the proprietor is a sweet Korean lady assisted by a faithful Korean speaking Latin American man who works three jobs.   They had a tough month in July and I will be heartbroken if they don't survive as their late hours 5:30-2am tues-sunday and their authentic food is part of my weekly routine.  

Definitely--along with Jang Soo BBQ--this place is the unrivaled in the city as the Best AUTHENTIC Korean food where NO shortcuts are taken.
author: grace k.

description: I really enjoyed eating here much more than another Korean restaurant I reviewed before called Muguboka. Everything we ordered was extremely tasty. The mandu, the dolsot bibim bap, and the gamja tang dishes were just marvelous and full of flavor. I was actually trying to pick some dishes that my fellow chinese friends would love after our long game of frisbee golf at Golden Gate Park. The service is par, but I was extremely impressed at how fast the mom there was able to churn out our food by herself. Although I am still in search of my favorite Korean place in the city, I am definitely looking to come here again!
author: Dave Y.

description: I love this restaurant! The ambiance is really warm and comforting, just like the food. Check out the hae mul soon dubu if you get a chance! :D
author: Ty L.

description: I had been in search of the K-food joint that prepared everything well. Previously it was "go to brothers for BBQ," "ToFu House for Sun Doo Boo Chigae," "Korea House for outta towners,"  "Won Mi for post party Duk Mandu Gook," and so on. Well Um Ma Son has it all. Every dish that came out was fresh, tasty and well prepared. My favorite all around K-food place. Plus they're open late.
author: Johnny C.

description:
um ma son is the white person's korean food joint.

i have to say i was excited about this place, and let down on almost everything with exception of the water. yea, the water.

they have water at the table, which is awesome. most asian places give you a small cup of tea for your entire meal the second you sit down. personally i can drink a liter of water with each meal, um ma son understands me.

their food is over priced and under portioned. brul gol gi at my tofu house down the street is $3-4 dollars less, of same or greater quality, and there's simply more of it.

it'd have to be pretty hard up to come back, tho i wanted this place to be a regular spot of mine.
author: Ameer N.

description: I've always passed by this place but I've never tried it. But I finally did recently. I came here with a friend who never really had Korean food before, besides bulgogi. We came here a bit after they just opened, so it was empty; & were greeted by a very sweet ahjumma (middle aged woman), who happened to be the cook & waiter as well! Triple threat! In addition to banchan (Korean side dishes), my friend & I both ordered bibimbap, except mines was in a stone pot, & ddubokki. I've had bibimbap at other places before, but Um Ma Son's was off the hook. My friend who barely finishes her food actually finished her bibimbap. The ddubokki was really good as well. However, there weren't much selection in the side dishes. Service was good too; maybe it was 'cause we were the only ones in there, but was really friendly. Food did take awhile to come out, but then again, the ahjumma was by herself. It was reasonably priced for a Korean restaurant. The place is fairly small; so come with a date, a small group of friends, or by yourself. I'll probably come back again just for the bibimbap, or maybe to try the soup.
author: BrendaJoy G.

description: For all you asians who love Brothers....this resturant is way better....i went on a friday night and for some reason there was no wait.  The food was delicious!  we ordere a pot of soup which was pretty $$ but, its well worth it, they actually use pork stock as the base of the soup....MmMMm....all the little side dishes of course.  We had some sort of rice cake, i think it was Kimchee rice cake and suprisingly it wasn't overwhelmingly sweet.  it tasted good.!   i highly recommend this place.  Definitely go back, its pretty much the same price as all the other korean rest. except this place actually taste good.  Also the mother and daugther were super nice...=) frive stars all the way.
author: Shirley H.

description:
adding a fuzzy 1.5  ish points for being open so damn late

food was good, came within a half an hour 
not amazing, didn't make me jump for joy, but didnt have my lower intesting practicing gymnastics the next day either.

The husband and wife team were appropriately charming for a mom and pop organization, and kindly brought takeaway boxes to our table, then put the stuff in it. 
I remembered that the next day when i scooped up what i THOUGHT was a mouthful of sauteed broccoli and bit in to all the super miniature dehydrated anchovies that were in a small plate next to my entree..

but the soup was good

and it was, like, 1:30 in the morning and i needed red meat

so i can't complain.

It certainly killed Carl's Jr. in the first round anyhow

thank god for the friend with the car.
author: Domini A.

description: This place has great marinated kalbi (it was piping hot!) and so was the dol solt bibimbap.  I like the fact this place does not have the bbqs at the tables.  Some people probably would prefer to cook their own food over the bbq (like at brothers), but I'm not a big fan of that because (a) I go out so I don't have to cook, (b) when I do cook it, I have to concentrate too much for fear of burning it or undercooking it and (c) my clothes reak of korean food, especially sweaters and jackets.  The owner is super friendly and gave us a free beverage to wash it down.   Also, when I went here, there was no wait which is tough waiting when you are hungry and can smell korean food.
author: Ben B.

description: The barbecue here is really good, though smaller portions than I was expecting. I loved everything, though the kimchi wasn't spicy enough! Grrr, that was really my only pet peeve. The lady who runs the place is on it, running around doing everything, paying special attention to make sure we were doing alright. Sometimes she stared and watched us eat, which was pretty weird! Love that this place is open late, too!
author: Violet S.

description: Great little restaurant.  The bi bim bap comes with a selection of kimchis.  Definitely want to go back!
author: Cristin O.

description: Great Korean food.  The service is very good - even when they're clearly busy.  I've been to MANY korean spots and I like this one because you can eat the food and taste the differences in what you bite.  Some of my closest friends like to eat stuff that's soooo spicy you can't even notice what it is you're biting into.  Really. In other restaurants it could be fish guts on one plate and beef on another, but you wouldn't know. This is the place I like to take my friends when the tell me they want Korean food. The standard table side dishes are really good.  One of the owners "Wendy" is really nice!!  She'll always be willing to educate new customers to Korean food aside from just letting you eat the typical stuff like Kal Bi.
author: Jubei K.

description: I had the haemul (seafood) dolsot bap and it was pretty decent. my aunt had the regular dolsot and she liked it. the restaurant is clean and the service is nice, which gives it the four stars.
author: Rosa K.

description:
Best Korean cooking I have had in a long time.  The rice cake appetizer was a HUGE and delicious, the Gun Mandu were good, but ordinary.  The soft tofu and beef soup was to die for. My partner had Dolsot Bi Bim Bop and the stone bowl was bristling hot, not to mention crammed with goodies.  Rge bowl was hot enough to toast the rice.  I had the Gal bi and again the portion was simply huge.  The Banchan were nice and the owner/waitress stopped twice to ask if we wanted refills.  The waitress, is also the owner and one of two cooks in the kitchen.  She runs the front of the house and the kitchen.
She is beyond belief!  On a scale of 1-10, this place is 134!!!
author: EDWARD S.

description:
This place serves standard Korean dishes - not particularly good, not particularly bad. 

However, unlike the majority of Korean restaurants around SF bay area, Ummason actually offers "sane" dining experience. No people standing around you waiting for tables, no interior "decoration" of prison efficiency, no flaming charcoals being passed around right next your face. And no risk of smelling delicious to street dogs after dinner as well! You can actually sit down and have a nice dinner here. (At least that was the case when we were there.) This place kinda looks nice too. That is new for a Korean restaurant in the Bay Area. 

We ordered dol-sot-bi-bim-baap (rice cooked in a stone pot and then mixed with vegetable and hot sauce) and kim-chi-tsi-kae (spicy cabbage pickle casserole). Both were almost as good as the same dishes form anywhere else we've tried all around the Bay Area.  

Ban-chaan (side dishes) cannot be described as of generous proportion or varied. (Six side dishes is not bad by all means, but they felt rather repetitive).  

I would go back to this place if I am in the area. Korean BBQ fans may be advised to gather courage to sit through the mind-numbing battle which is dinner at Brother's BBQ.
author: Sherwin L.

description: *This is the best Korean restaurant in the city ever*....!!!! the food is great..... and the service is great....  you have to at least visit the restaurant more than once to try everything!!!!!
author: JeNny C.

description: I Love This Place! I've been coming here from day one. Great food, Great service. The owner always knows what i want "Jap chae" and she hooks it up When i bring a bunch of friends. This place is also great to Bring a date!
author: Henry W.

description:
i've accepted the fact that korean food just simply sucks arse out in san francisco ... it's a given ...  i KNOW I KNOW, it's SF and i can't compare it, but ive tried to bypass that whole SFness but i guess i've just been TOO* spoiled ... and even though my fridge is stocked up with homemade korean stuff, thanks to my dearest mommy, i occasionally feel like getting the f outta my place and eat ... 

um ma son ...

what a cute, catchy name ...

umma son = mom's hand ... basically meaning, it's supposed to be that darn old home made cooking yo momma used to make ... meaning, it MUST be good stuff ...prices are relatively average, approx $9 and up..  i love how the the wall seats were covered with those korean bahngsuks (cushion) not the fluffy kind, but enough to give out that korean culture ... 

food was SO bad ...  i feel SO* bad saying this because the ajuma was actually really nice ... an extra star does go out to the service.

the galbi (bbq short ribs) was actually decent but a bit too oily ... their seafood rice bowl in the stone pot was average too ... the secret to any korean cooking // restaurant is, if their bahnchan (sidedishes) are excellent, you can expect excellent, quality homemade cooking ... 

korean food in sf puts korean food in general to SHAME!! =(

it's alllllllll good, since i'm off to another LA trip in a few, and THIS TIME, i'm gonna eat some REAL food .. ya heard? :)
author: Jennifer S.

description: Really delicious homey Korean food.....not only were the dishes really great, but the panchans were excellent too...very fresh!  i love this place!
author: Rachell K.

description: teeny tiny (maybe fits 20 max) clean space to get decent korean food. i'm not used to places where you don't grill your own meat but i must say, i enjoyed the food. the mandoo guk made from homemade dumplings along with the haemul pahjun (seafood pancake) which we got as service was muy excellente! i never paid so little for korean food but then again, i ate family style with anorexic, non-eating girls. =P
author: Jane Y.

description: this is my new favorite restaurant...we had the kalbi, soon dubu and ddukbokki and it was all delicious.  everything tasted fresh and homemade and the service was wonderful...
author: Grace P.

description: Excellent food, great service, and friendly people!  Best Korean restaurant in SF!
author: mo y.

description: I really like this korean restaurant. It just seems cleaner and less bustling and hurried than any others i've been to. Good kimchee, never crowded. Their soft tofu soup is yummy and they have a vegetarian version! And no MSG! And they are open late! And no corkage fee! And...well, you get it. Check it out.
author: Mayra S.

description: I really loved it.  I actually live about 10 blocks away from Um Ma Son and every time I go home around midnight, I'd always pass by Um Ma Son and notice how late it opens.  Since I always drive to LA or Las Vegas with my family and arrive back in SF late at night, it appealed to me and I finally tried it today.  It was very very good.  It opens at 5:30 but I went there at 5:00 and a very kind lady who was eating opened the door for us and let us in even though it didn't open yet.  I kinda felt bad because I could tell she was having her dinner and we disrupted it, but nonetheless, the food was amazing.  The soup was really good and it didn't cause me to have diahhrea like other places would and no MSG.  I really enjoyed it because the kind lady was full of smiles and the food came on the table VERY quickly.  It's my new favorite Korean restaurant to go to :D
author: Fiona C.

description: I love this place. Everything about it. The food is amazing and the lady who owns it is sweet. I have had Bi Bim Bap and Kimchi Tofu soup. I can't get enough of it. I even asked my partner to take me here on Valentines day.
author: Kim R.

description: Good, consistent presentations of all your old favorite Korean dishes, particularly soup and stew entrees. Portions are usually pretty generous and make for a reasonably priced meal. Service is also pretty good and the place usually isn't packed. Not a bad spot for a quiet dinner.
author: A P.

description: Fantastic Local Korean!  The bim bap and kimchee soup rock!  :)  The older lady owner/cook/waitress is adorable...My wife and I really enjoyed the anchovies and radish.  They're open until 2am and I really feel at home here...Cheers!
author: Diparshi M.

description: I read about the Superwoman and had to make a trip here for my first time eating Korean Food.  Just like everyone mentioned, the place was empty and Superwoman was there by herself.  We ordered a #17 (Stone bowl dish) & #21 (Sliced Meat on Onions).  I didn't know what to order so as I was looking at the menu, she helped me decide on these two items.  Both were excellent and very tasty (sauce on #21 was yummy).  All the cool side dishes that come when you order food were also great.  One dish was a bit pricey (#21) but I didn't mind because of the excellent service and delicious home cooked meal.  She prepared everything for us sooo fast and you could see her cleaning up after herself when she was done.  She was constantly checking on us for refills on sides and tea.  She does do everything in this nice small restaurant BY HERSELF.  Props to her for knowing how to take care of her customers well.  I will come back again.
author: nima s.
